page.title: 04ROAD TRANSPORT,NEWTON MEARNS
page.content: Our survey showed that while the Mearns area has a high proportion of car owners, an efficient and reliable public transport system is still important for the young and elderly. The Western S.M.T. bus company (now Clydeside S.M.T.) provide two local services and some passing-through services to and from Ayr, Carlisle, Castle Douglas, Newton Stewart and Stranraer. Two main routes take traffic into this area. These arteries are Ayr Rd and Mearnskirk Rd 1km apart. At peak times Ayr road carries about 1000 vehicles in each direction per hour. This is halved at off-peak times. The Mearnskirk road carries about 2/3 as much as Ayr road. A proposed extension to the M77 from Haggs Castle should improve the road network in this area.
